meanings.definition: The act of despising or feeling contempt for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her despisement towards her rival was evident in the way she avoided eye contact.
meanings.sent2: The despisement towards the new policy was shared by many employees.
meanings.sent3: Despite his despisement for broccoli, he tried to hide it in his napkin without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds of despisement hovered over the relationship, casting a shadow on their interactions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's despisement for cheating students was well-known among the class.

meanings.definition: The state of being despised or held in contempt.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's despisement by society led to his isolation from the community.
meanings.sent2: Living in constant despisement can take a toll on one's mental health.
meanings.sent3: The despisement of the old, broken chair turned into a running joke among the family.
meanings.sent4: In the world of competitive sports, second place often faces the despisement of being so close yet not winning.
meanings.sent5: The despisement of the neglected park was a call to action for the local residents.
